001package squidpony.squidmath;
002
003/**
004 * A group of similar methods for getting hashes of points based on int coordinates in 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6 dimensions and
005 * an int for state; here, points are considered toroidally wrapping, where the wrap happens at a power of two that is
006 * no greater than 1024. This implementation stores 6 caches of 1024 numbers each, where each cache is used for a
007 * different dimension, and XORs the values along with the seed before running through Thomas Wang's integer hash.
008 */
009public final class TorusCachePointHash extends IPointHash.IntImpl {
010
011    protected final int[] cache;
012    protected int wrap = 63;
013    public TorusCachePointHash() {
014        cache = new int[6 * 1024];
015        setState(42);
016    }
017
018    public TorusCachePointHash(int state) {
019        cache = new int[6 * 1024];
020        setState(state);
021    }
022
023    public TorusCachePointHash(int state, int wrapAt) {
024        cache = new int[6 * 1024];
025        setState(state);
026        wrap = HashCommon.nextPowerOfTwo(wrapAt) - 1;
027    }
028
029    @Override
030    public void setState(int state) {
031        this.state = state;
032        SilkRNG rng = new SilkRNG(state);
033        for (int i = 0; i < cache.length; i++) {
034            cache[i] = rng.nextInt();
035        }
036    }
037
038    /**
039     * Thomas Wang's 2002 integer hash.
040     * @param x any int
041     * @return a usually different and very-scrambled int
042     */
043    public static int determineInt(int x){
044        x += ~(x << 15);
045        x ^= x >>> 10;
046        x += x << 3;
047        x ^= x >>> 6;
048        x += ~(x << 11);
049        x ^= x >>> 16;
050        return x;
051    }
052
053    @Override
054    public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int state) {
055        return determineInt(state ^ cache[(x & wrap)] ^ cache[(y & wrap) + 1024]);
056    }
057
058    @Override
059    public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int state) {
060        return determineInt(state ^ cache[(x & wrap)] ^ cache[(y & wrap) + 1024] ^ cache[(z & wrap) + 2048]);
061    }
062
063    @Override
064    public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int state) {
065        return determineInt(state ^ cache[(x & wrap)] ^ cache[(y & wrap) + 1024] ^ cache[(z & wrap) + 2048]
066                ^ cache[(w & wrap) + 3072]);
067    }
068
069    @Override
070    public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int state) {
071        return determineInt(state ^ cache[(x & wrap)] ^ cache[(y & wrap) + 1024] ^ cache[(z & wrap) + 2048]
072                ^ cache[(w & wrap) + 3072] ^ cache[(u & wrap) + 4096]);
073    }
074
075    @Override
076    public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int v, int state) {
077        return determineInt(state ^ cache[(x & wrap)] ^ cache[(y & wrap) + 1024] ^ cache[(z & wrap) + 2048]
078                ^ cache[(w & wrap) + 3072] ^ cache[(u & wrap) + 4096] ^ cache[(v & wrap) + 5120]);
079
080    }
081}
